title: :style with multiline attribute removes root element in all versions of IE
body:
### Vue.js version 2.0.0-rc5 ### Browser Internet Explorer 10 Microsoft Edge ### Reproduction Link http://danieldiekmeier.de/vue/1.html // This one doesn't show anything http://danieldiekmeier.de/vue/2.html // This one shows "Hello" in Red, as expected ### Steps to reproduce This is the HTML that does **not** work: ``` html
Hello
``` This is the HTML that **does** work: ``` html
Hello
``` This is the JavaScript: ``` js new Vue({ el: '#app' }) ``` ### What is Expected? ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2098462/18436178/359c77ea-78f7-11e6-83aa-e018bfdca196.png) No matter if I enter the `:style` attribute in multiple lines or not, it should always work the same. (It also works in both cases if I use Vue v1). In Chrome and Firefox, both versions are working. ### What is actually happening? ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2098462/18436183/41c68f1a-78f7-11e6-810d-d28fb3106b48.png) (Here you can see the `#app` div completely missing in the DOM tree.) When using IE (11, in my case) or Edge, the whole root element (`#app`) gets completely thrown out of the DOM as soon as Vue starts rendering. This happens regardless of emulated document mode (Edge, 10, 9 all behave the same). (I was _not_ able to reproduce this bug in a JSFiddle, even when using exactly this code. But in the examples above, it does happen). Here is the fiddle: https://jsfiddle.net/gzd6o9ob/4/
